result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew E Heller

records.addlTxt: 11:16 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Matthew E Heller not in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Matthew E Heller.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Martinez advises he attempted to call and text his client with no response and has no explanation for his client's non-appearance.  Court notes defendant was advised he needed to appear today or a capias would issue.  Based on the defendant's non-appearance Court will issue the capias and order bail be forfeited.
EXT Code #3
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:39 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew E Heller not in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Matthew E Heller. Atty. Martinez notes he was in contact with his client who will not be able to appear today due to illness.  Atty. Martinez advises he does have medical proof and if needed the defendant is available by telephone today.  Atty. Martinez provides an update with respect to the case; he has discovery but needs additional time to review it all.  Atty. Martinez requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  State has no objection to an adjournment for status but is asking the court to authorize but stay a capias until the next court date.  Court will take no action with respect to a capias today, will adjourn for status in about 3 weeks and notes if the defendant does not appear at that time this court will issue a capias.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return of Notice of Assignment of Judge addressed to defendant.
Hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:07 AM Defendant Matthew E Heller in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Matthew E Heller. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Nicholas Martinez
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is to follow all conditions of Department of Corrections while in residential treatment and to have no contact with the co-defendant when released from treatment.  Defendant to have no contact with victims/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Current: 2404 N 50th Street, c/o Joshua Glover Halfway House, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 07-26-2022)

02:30 PM Defendant Matthew E Heller in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
